alert.note: Alert for Haskell; Latimer; Le Flore; Pittsburg; Pushmataha (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 24 at 1:36AM CDT until September 24 at 4:45AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Haskell County in southeastern Oklahoma... Latimer County in southeastern Oklahoma... Southern Le Flore County in southeastern Oklahoma... Southern Pittsburg County in southeastern Oklahoma... Northern Pushmataha County in southeastern Oklahoma... * Until 445 AM CDT. * At 136 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a large complex of thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Hourly rainfall rates in excess of 2 inches will be possible. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mcalester... Wilburton... Clayton... Hartshorne... Krebs... Talihina... Kiowa... Savanna... Red Oak... Fanshawe... Alderson... Albion... Yanush... Kiamichi... Tuskahoma... Damon... Clayton Lake State Park... Bengal... Higgins... Nashoba... This includes the following streams and drainages... Brazil Creek, One Creek, Caney Creek, Little Fourche Maline, Blue Creek, Peach Creek, Turkey Creek, Caston Creek, Clear Creek, Mill Creek, Mud Creek, Kimbrough Creek, Big Eagle Creek, Brier Creek, Bohannon Creek, Fourche Maline, Stovepipe Creek, Holson Creek, Sans Bois Creek, Hackett Creek, Anderson Creek, Canadian River, North Fork Walnut Creek, Woods Creek, Frazier Creek, Dog Creek, Jefferson Creek, Elm Creek, North Holly Creek, Polecat Creek, Little Cedar Creek, North Watson Creek, Coal Creek, Maxwell Creek, Ash Creek, Fobb Creek, Cunneo Tubby Creek, Kiamichi River, Rock Creek, North Jack Creek, Billy Creek, Little Buffalo Creek, Hominy Creek, Piney Branch, Beech Creek, Harris Creek, Birney Creek, Eaton Creek, Uphill Creek, Peaceable Creek, Cedar Creek, Big Cedar Creek, Bolen Creek, West Fork Anderson Creek, Hurd Creek, Owl Creek, Watson Creek, Fizzell Branch, Gardner Creek, Brushy Creek, Red Oak Creek, Marble Creek, Bandy Creek, Little Cow Creek, North Cedar Creek, Coon Creek, Little Buzzard Creek, West Fork, Buffalo Creek, Cloudy Creek, Pine Creek, Wildhorse Creek, Tenmile Creek, Cow Creek, Chippewa Creek, Poteau River, Snow Creek, Little Eagle Creek, Cripple Creek, Crumb Creek, Pope Creek, Little Caston Creek, Leflore Creek, Patterson Creek, Post Oak Creek, Albion Creek, Prairie Creek, Beaver Creek, Peveyhouse Creek, Jackfork Creek, Jackson Creek, Long Bell Creek, Deadman Creek, Little Rock Creek, Mule Creek, Modisette Creek, Gaines Creek, Black Fork, Dry Run, Bull Creek, Camp Creek, Bryant Branch, East Billy Creek, South Gaines Creek, Short Creek, Jack Creek, Beulah Creek, Potts Creek, Little Wildhorse Creek, Grassy Creek, Chickasaw Creek, Johns Creek, Robison Creek, South Fork Elm Creek, Long Creek, Possum Creek, Pickens Creek, Pigeon Creek, Peterson Creek, Buzzard Creek, Buck Creek, Chun Creek, Dry Creek, Lily Pond Creek, Conser Creek, Bridge Set Creek, Mountain Fork, Little River, North Boggy Creek and Wildcat Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Haskell; Latimer; Le Flore; Pittsburg; Pushmataha
